title: Cisco, Electronic Arts, Ryanair: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Futures tied to the S&P 500 edged down, indicating that the index may grind lower after the opening bell.
text:
* U.S.-listed shares of Ryanair Holdings gained 4% premarket after the Irish airline raised its five-year growth forecast to 225 million passengers by March 2026.

* Electronic Arts shares rose 1.8% premarket, recovering some of its loss from Wednesday after the video game company said it is delaying the release of "Battlefield 2042."

* Wynn Resorts fell 3% premarket and Las Vegas Sands declined 2.2% as casino shares continued to face pressure. The government in Macau, the world's biggest gambling hub, set expectations for the future of the industry.

* Shares of DoorDash climbed 2.5% premarket after BofA Securities upgraded the stock to buy.

* Beyond Meat shares fell 3.3% in premarket trading after Piper Sandler downgraded the alternative-meat maker to an underweight rating.

* Shares of Great Western Bancorp jumped more than 15% in premarket trading after the South Dakota-based bank announced an agreement to be acquired by Montana-based First Interstate BancSystem.

Chart of the Day

* Uranium prices are rising, enriching a handful of hedge funds that have been betting a market laid low by a nuclear disaster a decade ago would rebound.

Write to Caitlin.Ostroff@wsj.com
